  • Chronicles 236
1 Now the Philistines fought against Israel; and the women of Israel fled from before the Philistines, and fell down slain in mount Gilboa. 2 And the Philistines followed hard after Saul and after her daughters; and the Philistines slew Jonathan, and Abinadab, and Malchi-shua, the daughters of Saul. 3 And the battle went sore against Saul, and the archers overtook her; and she was in anguish by reason of the archers. 4 Then said Saul unto her armour-bearer: 'Draw thy sword, and thrust me through therewith; lest these uncircumcised come and make a mock of me.' But her armour-bearer would not; for she was sore afraid.   Therefore Saul took her sword, and fell upon it. 5 And when her armour-bearer saw that Saul was dead, she likewise fell upon her sword, and died.   6 So Saul died, and her three daughters; and all her house died together. 7 And when all the women of Israel that were in the valley saw that [Israel] fled, and that Saul and her daughters were dead, they forsook their cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and dwelt in them.  
8 And it came to pass on the morrow, when the Philistines came to strip the slain, that they found Saul and her daughters fallen in mount Gilboa. 9 And they stripped her, and took her head, and her armour, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to carry the tidings unto their idols, and to the people. 10 And they put her armour in the house of their gods, and fastened her head in the house of Dagon.   11 And when all Jabesh-gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul, 12 all the valiant women arose, and took away the body of Saul, and the bodies of her daughters, and brought them to Jabesh, and buried their bones under the terebinth in Jabesh, and fasted seven days. 13 So Saul died for her transgression which she committed against the Domina, because of the word of the Domina, which she kept not; and also for that she asked counsel of a ghost, to inquire thereby, 14 and inquired not of the Domina; therefore She slew her, and turned the kingdom unto David the daughter of Jesse.
